What is the purpose of the `sendreserve` command in Verus, and how can I use it to send reserve currency to an address on the current PBaaS reserve chain?

The `sendreserve` command is used to send reserve currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain. Reserve currency on a PBaaS chain is equivalent to and convertible between the native VRSCTEST currency. You can use the command as follows:
```
./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000}'
```
This command sends 5000 units of reserve currency to the specified payment address on the current PBaaS reserve chain, without performing a cross-chain operation.

**Sending reserve currency to an address on the current PBaaS reserve chain with no cross-chain operation, Reserve currency on a PBaaS chain is equivalent to and convertible between the native VRSCTEST currency, but may also be sent to and used on PBaaS reserve chains. It will arrive as reserve currency.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000}' ```**Sending native currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain and converting it to reserve currency at the same time at the current market price.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000, "toreserve": 1}' ```**Sending reserve currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain and converting it to native currency at the same time at the current price. It will arrive as native currency.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000, "tonative": 1}' ```**Getting the current price in reserve and other currency statistics for the most recent block.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate ``` **... a specific block.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate blocknum ``` **... a range with a specific period between**. ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate startblocknum,endblocknum,blockstostep ``` **Refunding contributions made to a failed PbaaS chain launch**. ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST refundfailedlaunch CHAINNAME ``` # DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! No warranty for any kind of damage! Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:The enclosed copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.

How can I send native currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain and convert it to reserve currency at the same time using the `sendreserve` command?

To send native currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain and convert it to reserve currency at the current market price, you can use the `sendreserve` command with the `toreserve` option set to 1:
```
./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000, "toreserve": 1}'
```
This command sends 5000 units of native currency to the specified payment address on the PBaaS reserve chain and converts it to reserve currency at the current market price.

**Sending reserve currency to an address on the current PBaaS reserve chain with no cross-chain operation, Reserve currency on a PBaaS chain is equivalent to and convertible between the native VRSCTEST currency, but may also be sent to and used on PBaaS reserve chains. It will arrive as reserve currency.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000}' ```**Sending native currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain and converting it to reserve currency at the same time at the current market price.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000, "toreserve": 1}' ```**Sending reserve currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain and converting it to native currency at the same time at the current price. It will arrive as native currency.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000, "tonative": 1}' ```**Getting the current price in reserve and other currency statistics for the most recent block.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate ``` **... a specific block.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate blocknum ``` **... a range with a specific period between**. ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate startblocknum,endblocknum,blockstostep ``` **Refunding contributions made to a failed PbaaS chain launch**. ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST refundfailedlaunch CHAINNAME ``` # DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. How can I get the current price in reserve and other currency statistics for the most recent block using Verus?

To get the current price in reserve and other currency statistics for the most recent block, you can use the `getcurrencystate` command:
```
./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate
```
This command returns the current currency statistics for the most recent block.

How do I send reserve currency to an address on the current PBaaS reserve chain without performing a cross-chain operation?

To send reserve currency to an address on the current PBaaS reserve chain without performing a cross-chain operation, you can use the `sendreserve` command with the following format:

```
./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "address", "amount":amount}'
```

How can I get currency statistics for a specific block or a range of blocks using Verus?

To get currency statistics for a specific block, you can use the `getcurrencystate` command with the block number:
```
./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate blocknum
```
To get currency statistics for a range of blocks, you can use the `getcurrencystate` command with the start block number, end block number, and the number of blocks to step:
```
./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate startblocknum,endblocknum,blockstostep
```

How can I refund contributions made to a failed PBaaS chain launch using Verus?

To refund contributions made to a failed PBaaS chain launch, you can use the `refundfailedlaunch` command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST refundfailedlaunch CHAINNAME
```

How can I get the current price and other currency statistics for a specific block or range of blocks on a PBaaS reserve chain using Verus?

You can get the current price and other currency statistics for a specific block or range of blocks on a PBaaS reserve chain using the `getcurrencystate` command with additional arguments. Here are some examples:

```
./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate blocknum
```

This will return the current price and other currency statistics for a specific block number.

```
./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate startblocknum,endblocknum,blockstostep
```

This will return the current price and other currency statistics for a range of blocks, stepping by the specified number of blocks.

**Sending reserve currency to an address on the current PBaaS reserve chain with no cross-chain operation, Reserve currency on a PBaaS chain is equivalent to and convertible between the native VRSCTEST currency, but may also be sent to and used on PBaaS reserve chains. It will arrive as reserve currency.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000}' ```**Sending native currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain and converting it to reserve currency at the same time at the current market price.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000, "toreserve": 1}' ```**Sending reserve currency to an address on a PBaaS reserve chain and converting it to native currency at the same time at the current price. It will arrive as native currency.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE sendreserve '{"paymentaddress": "R9LkTaMn1XpjeorE4RjM6pMcy5Nxkx9jPM", "amount":5000, "tonative": 1}' ```**Getting the current price in reserve and other currency statistics for the most recent block.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate ``` **... a specific block.** ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate blocknum ``` **... a range with a specific period between**. ``` ./verus -chain=RESERVEWITHPREMINE getcurrencystate startblocknum,endblocknum,blockstostep ``` **Refunding contributions made to a failed PbaaS chain launch**. ``` verus -chain=VRSCTEST refundfailedlaunch CHAINNAME ``` # DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. How can I refund contributions made to a failed PBaaS chain launch using Verus?

You can refund contributions made to a failed PBaaS chain launch using the `refundfailedlaunch` command. Here's an example:

```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST refundfailedlaunch CHAINNAME
```

This will refund the contributions made to the failed PBaaS chain launch specified by `CHAINNAME`.
